voicesplitting.gui

Class MidiNoteGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • voicesplitting.gui.MidiNoteGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class MidiNoteGUI
extends javax.swing.JLabel
    A MidiNoteGUI object controls the GUI layout of a MidiNote.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 17 June, 2015
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • note

        private MidiNote note
        The note which this GUI object represents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MidiNoteGUI

        public MidiNoteGUI(MidiNote note,
           int horizontalScale,
           int verticalScale)
        Create a new default MidiNoteGUI based on the given note at the given scale.
        Parameters:
        note - note
        horizontalScale - The horizontal scale of this GUI object. Note times will be divided by this amount to get layout location.
        verticalScale - The vertical scale of this GUI object. Note pitches will be multiplied by this amount to get layout location.

    • Method Detail

      • updateBorder

        public void updateBorder()
        Update the border of this note to reflect any possible changes in the underlying NoteDisplayer.

      • isHighlighted

        public boolean isHighlighted()
        Return if this note is highlighted or not.
        Returns:
        True if this note is currently highlighted. False otherwise.

      • setHighlighted

        protected void setHighlighted(boolean highlight)
        Set whether this note is highlighted or not, and change the border of this note appropriately.
        Parameters:
        highlight - True to highlight this note. False otherwise.

      • setDefaultBorder

        private void setDefaultBorder(boolean voices)
        Set the default border back on this note.
        Parameters:
        voices - Whether we are displaying guessed voices or not.

      • setScale

        public void setScale(int horizontalScale,
            int verticalScale)
        Rescale this MidiNoteGUI based on the given scales.
        Parameters:
        horizontalScale - The horizontal scale of this GUI object. Note times will be divided by this amount to get layout location.
        verticalScale - The vertical scale of this GUI object. Note pitches will be multiplied by this amount to get layout location.

      • getNote

        public MidiNote getNote()
        Get the note of this note gui object.
        Returns:
        note

      • getDisplayer

        public NoteDisplayer getDisplayer()
        Get the NoteDisplayer containing this note.
        Returns:
        The NoteDisplayer containing this note.

      • isVoices

        public boolean isVoices()
        Get whether to show the guessed voice or not.
        Returns:
        True if we want to display guessed voices. False otherwise.

      • getColor

        public static java.awt.Color getColor(int index)
        Get the color for the given voice index.

        The color is loaded from the GUIConstants.COLORS array if the index is less than its length, or set to black otherwise.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the voice whose color we want.
        Returns:
        The corresponding color.

      • generateToolTipText

        public java.lang.String generateToolTipText()
        Get the String to be used as the ToolTip text for this note.
        Returns:
        The tooltip text.
